intro: Chaetonychia, commonly known as the "milkweed tree," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce showy, clustered flowers in various colors. Chaetonychia species are often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid environments. Their flowers are pollinated primarily by birds and insects, contributing to their ecological significance.
